name: Yallaiah Onteru
title: Power Platform + Azure OpenAI + Copilot Studio Techno-Functional Consultant
professional_summary: I'm bringing 10 years of experience in AI automation, cloud solutions, and enterprise workflow transformation across Insurance, Healthcare, Banking, and Consulting domains with deep expertise in Microsoft ecosystem.

Using Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI) to build rapid prototypes and production-grade automation solutions, I've delivered enterprise-scale workflows that integrate seamlessly with Azure OpenAI and Copilot Studio for intelligent assistance.

With Azure OpenAI services, I've architected generative AI solutions leveraging prompt engineering, embeddings, chat completions, and retrieval-augmented workflows to transform business processes and enable AI-driven decision-making capabilities.

Building custom copilots in Microsoft Copilot Studio, I've created conversational flows, plugins, generative actions, and bot integrations that solved complex business challenges and improved user engagement through intelligent automation.

Partnering with business stakeholders to identify automation opportunities, I've led discovery sessions that translated pain points into actionable blueprints using Power Platform best practices while ensuring scalability and governance adherence.

Developing rapid prototypes within 1-3 day build cycles, I've demonstrated art of the possible solutions that combined Power Automate orchestrations with Azure OpenAI capabilities to showcase immediate value and accelerate innovation initiatives.

Integrating Power Platform with enterprise systems like Dataverse, SharePoint, REST APIs, and Azure services, I've built end-to-end automation workflows that connected disparate data sources while maintaining security and compliance standards.

Through Power BI, I've designed interactive dashboards and real-time analytics solutions that provided actionable insights, enabling stakeholders to make data-driven decisions while monitoring AI-powered automation performance metrics.

Working with agentic frameworks like CrewAI, LangGraph, and multi-agent systems, I've architected proof-of-concept solutions that demonstrated advanced AI orchestration patterns and model context protocol implementations for Insurance domain projects.

Using Azure OpenAI embedding models and vector databases, I've implemented semantic search capabilities within Power Platform solutions that enhanced information retrieval accuracy and improved user experience in healthcare compliance scenarios.

Leading technical documentation efforts, I've created architecture diagrams, flow charts, data models, and technical assumptions for each prototype while ensuring alignment with M365 governance and responsible AI standards for production readiness.

Presenting prototypes to diverse business groups, I've gathered feedback and iterated solutions based on stakeholder input, demonstrating feasibility analysis and scalability considerations that aligned with enterprise automation strategy.

Building reusable components, templates, and patterns in Power Platform, I've accelerated subsequent prototype development cycles while maintaining consistency across solutions and reducing time-to-value for business stakeholders.

Through prompt flow orchestrations in Azure OpenAI, I've designed conversational AI experiences that handled complex business logic, integrated with external APIs, and provided contextual responses aligned with domain-specific requirements.

Developing generative actions and plugins in Copilot Studio, I've extended bot capabilities to interact with backend systems, trigger Power Automate flows, and deliver personalized experiences that adapted to user intent and context.

Ensuring adherence to security best practices, I've implemented role-based access controls, data loss prevention policies, and compliance measures within Power Platform solutions that met HIPAA, PCI, and regulatory requirements.

Working closely with cross-functional teams during code reviews and troubleshooting sessions, I've debugged complex integration issues between Power Platform components and Azure services while maintaining solution stability.

Initially struggled with scaling prototype solutions to production environments, but learned to design architectures that balanced rapid development with enterprise-grade performance, eventually becoming proficient in production transition strategies.

Cloud Platforms: Azure (ML Studio, Data Factory, Databricks, Cosmos DB, Functions)
AWS (S3, SageMaker, Lambda, EC2, RDS, Bedrock)

Leveraging Power Automate to solve repetitive approval workflows, I've orchestrated multi-stage automation flows connecting SharePoint, Dataverse, and Azure OpenAI embeddings that intelligently routed requests based on semantic content analysis.

Through CrewAI and LangGraph frameworks on Azure, I've architected multi-agent proof-of-concept systems for Insurance underwriting that coordinated specialized AI agents, demonstrating advanced orchestration patterns for risk assessment workflows.

Building rapid prototypes within 2-day cycles using Power Platform, I've demonstrated art of the possible solutions to business stakeholders by combining Power BI dashboards with Azure OpenAI insights that visualized claim trends and predicted outcomes.

Using Model Context Protocol implementations, I've developed agent-to-agent communication systems that enabled seamless data exchange between Azure OpenAI services and Power Platform connectors, creating unified automation experiences for complex Insurance scenarios.

Partnering with business users during discovery sessions, I've translated Insurance domain challenges into technical blueprints by mapping current processes to Power Automate flows enhanced with Azure OpenAI decision-making capabilities for intelligent automation.

Struggled initially with scaling prototype vector embeddings to production loads, but worked closely with Azure team to optimize retrieval-augmented generation pipelines using Azure Cognitive Search and partitioned Dataverse tables for improved performance.

Using prompt engineering techniques with Azure OpenAI, I've fine-tuned chat completion models to understand Insurance terminology and regulatory requirements, ensuring generated responses aligned with State Farm compliance standards and policy guidelines.

Using Power BI with AWS RDS data sources, I've built risk analytics dashboards for credit portfolios that integrated predictive models and visualized default probabilities, enabling risk managers to identify high-risk segments proactively.

With Power Automate, I've created automated reporting workflows that extracted transaction data from AWS S3, processed fraud detection alerts, and distributed insights to compliance teams while ensuring PCI DSS compliance throughout the pipeline.

Leveraging Power Apps for internal banking tools, I've developed loan application tracking systems connected to AWS databases that streamlined approval workflows and improved visibility into application status for relationship managers.

Through Power Platform integration with AWS services, I've automated regulatory reporting processes that aggregated data from multiple sources using AWS Lambda functions and generated compliance reports aligned with banking regulations.

Building analytics prototypes using Power BI and AWS data lakes, I've demonstrated machine learning insights to banking executives that showcased customer segmentation patterns and cross-sell opportunities derived from transactional behavior.

Using Power Automate approval workflows, I've streamlined credit decision processes that integrated with core banking systems via REST APIs and routed applications based on risk scores, reducing approval cycle time significantly.

With Power Query M language, I've transformed complex financial datasets from AWS S3 into Power BI data models that supported risk analysis and regulatory reporting while maintaining data lineage for audit requirements.

Partnering with compliance officers during requirements gathering, I've translated banking regulations into automated validation rules within Power Automate flows that enforced data quality standards and flagged anomalies for investigation.

Had to debug performance issues in Power BI dashboards loading large transaction datasets from AWS, eventually learning to implement incremental refresh strategies and aggregation tables that improved report responsiveness for executive users.

Using DAX calculations in Power BI, I've built financial metrics and KPIs that tracked loan portfolio performance and customer profitability, providing business intelligence insights that informed strategic banking decisions and product offerings.

It's my first time working with enterprise data pipelines, so I collaborated with senior engineers to build ETL workflows using Informatica PowerCenter that extracted data from client systems and loaded into Hadoop clusters for analytics.

Using Sqoop for data ingestion, I've transferred relational database tables into HDFS by running import jobs that moved large volumes of transactional data, learning how to optimize parallel transfers and handle schema evolution challenges.

With Hadoop MapReduce, I've assisted in developing data transformation jobs that processed raw data files stored in HDFS, aggregating metrics and preparing datasets for downstream analytics while debugging execution failures during testing phases.

Through Informatica workflows, I've automated data validation processes that checked data quality and triggered alerts when inconsistencies were detected, helping ensure reliable data delivery to business intelligence teams for reporting.

Working on data migration projects, I've used Informatica to extract legacy system data and transform formats for modern platforms, learning proper error handling and logging practices by reviewing code with experienced team members.

Using Hadoop Hive, I've created database tables and wrote SQL queries to analyze large datasets stored in HDFS, supporting business analysts who needed insights from consolidated data warehouses for client deliverables.

Struggled with Sqoop connection failures when importing data initially, but learned troubleshooting techniques from teammates and eventually became comfortable configuring JDBC drivers and resolving network connectivity issues independently.

Participating in team meetings and code reviews, I've learned best practices for ETL development, documentation standards, and testing procedures that improved my technical skills and understanding of enterprise data engineering requirements.
